name: The Lonesome Drifter
detailed_location: Slightly east of theEl Dorado Dry LakeComplete Talent Pool:The TopsThe Acestheater
voice_actor: Gregory Alan Williams(speaking voice)Joshua Sawyer(singing voice)

topics.topic_text: GREETING
topics.response_text: Howdy there, partner.

topics.topic_text: That's a mighty fine guitar you got there.
topics.response_text: Oh, this old thing? Why, thanks, friend. This here{GEE-tar}guitar is just about the only thing my daddy left me.

topics.topic_text: Tommy Torini at the Tops is looking for musical acts, if you're interested.
topics.response_text: Son, where I come from, a man doesn't just walk up to another man and offer him a job without even knowing him. What's your game?

topics.topic_text: What's your story, stranger?
topics.response_text: My story's a long one, friend, and I can't say as it's all that interesting.

topics.topic_text: No game. I offered to keep an eye out for talented acts, is all.
topics.response_text: {Skeptical}Uh-huh. Sorry stranger, just not sure I trust that kind of charity from somebody I don't even know.

topics.topic_text: Tommy offered me a recruiting fee.
topics.response_text: Well, at least you're honest, I guess. Sorry, I just don't take charity from strangers.

topics.topic_text: Here, take his card. Tell him I sent you.
topics.response_text: Much obliged to you, friend.

topics.topic_text: I'm giving you a real opportunity here - how about some compensation?
topics.response_text: [SUCCEEDED] I suppose it's only right you get a little something for your troubles. Here - my daddy left me this gun. Guess I don't need it no more.

topics.topic_text: On second thought, I don't think you're the right fit after all.
topics.response_text: No apologies needed, friend - I'm sure there's somebody out there'll appreciate my singing.

topics.topic_text: Have you been playing long?
topics.response_text: Just about my whole life, ever since my daddy left ma and me and went off to roam the wastes.

topics.topic_text: When did your father leave?
topics.response_text: Long time ago, now. I never even knew him. Ma always said he was a mysterious feller, always traveling on in secret.

topics.topic_text: Let's talk about something else.
topics.response_text: Looking for a story, huh? All right, what can I tell you?

topics.topic_text: Nevertheless, I'm interested.
topics.response_text: Well, I was born in a little town out Montana way. Me and Ma didn't have much, ever since my pa up and left.

topics.topic_text: Oh, okay then, never mind.
topics.response_text: Anything else you'd like to know?

topics.topic_text: Your father abandoned you?
topics.response_text: That he did. Never did know why. Ma always said he was a real mysterious feller, even when he was with her. Like he was a stranger sometimes.

topics.topic_text: Smart guy. Families just tie you down.
topics.response_text: Maybe that's how you was raised, but where I come from a man does right by his wife and child or he ain't no kinda man at all.

topics.topic_text: Wait, Montana? You wouldn't happen to be 17, would you?
topics.response_text: No sir, I'm 28. Why?

topics.topic_text: Sounds like you miss him. Is that why you're out here wandering?
topics.response_text: Maybe. Maybe I just never felt like I belonged back home.

topics.topic_text: I'm sure he had a reason for leaving.
topics.response_text: Maybe he did, maybe he didn't, but that don't change the fact that it wasn't right.

topics.topic_text: It must have been hard growing up without a father.
topics.response_text: It sure wasn't easy. Ma worked her fingers to the bone to make sure we had enough to survive, and I worked the coal mines from when I was fifteen.

topics.topic_text: You were better off without him. You became your own man, outside of his shadow.
topics.response_text: I suppose there's that, but a man oughta know his own Pa, and a woman oughtn't have to work herself to an early grave to provide for her family.

topics.topic_text: And what will you do when you find him?
topics.response_text: Can't say as I really know. Maybe I'll just ask him why. Maybe I'll punch him right in the mouth.

topics.topic_text: He sounds like a scumbag. You should make him pay.
topics.response_text: Maybe I will. Or maybe I'll just ask him why he left. Hell, the more I talk about it, the more the whole damn thing sounds like a dumb idea.

topics.topic_text: Sounds like you should move on. Settle down, maybe.
topics.response_text: Maybe I should. Don't suppose you know anyplace a feller with a{GEE-tar}guitar might find a job, huh?

topics.topic_text: Can't say that I do, sorry.
topics.response_text: Ah well. It was worth a shot.

description:
The Lonesome Drifter is a 28 year-old Asian Male.

A wandering musician with a mysterious past, searching for his father across the Mojave Wasteland. Born around 2253, he has spent years living a nomadic lifestyle, growing increasingly disillusioned with his quest. By 2281, he has set up camp at El Dorado Dry Lake, contemplating whether to abandon his search and settle down permanently.

The Lonesome Drifter's Personality: Contemplative and somewhat disillusioned, the Drifter is pragmatic about his situation but still carries a sense of longing. He's independent and self-reliant, having survived alone in the wasteland for most of his adult life. Despite his tough exterior, he possesses a creative streak through his music and occasionally shows vulnerability when discussing his family.

The Lonesome Drifter's Backstory: Born in 2253 to a mother who never spoke of his father, the Lonesome Drifter grew up with a burning question about his paternal heritage. As a young adult, he embarked on a quest to find his father, unsure of what he would do if he actually found him. For years, he wandered the wasteland, taking odd jobs and playing music for caps in various settlements. His search led him across the Mojave, but as the years passed, he began to question whether his quest was worth the effort. By 2281, fatigue had set in, and he found himself camping at El Dorado Dry Lake, pondering whether to give up his nomadic lifestyle and settle down.
